intro: Cicerbita grandiflora, commonly known as the large-flowered cicerbit, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves that are hairy and have a slightly serrated edge. Its flowering period occurs in late spring to early summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Cicerbita grandiflora is often found in rocky soils and open woodland areas, where it thrives in full sun to partial shade.
